required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anatomical Femoral Stem in Total Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Short Term Results of Short Anatomical Femoral Stem in Total Hip Arthroplasty - Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: A study that detect the femoral anteversion after total hip arthroplasty using short anatomical femoral stem compared to the contrast side

primary_outcome.time_frame: Post-Operatively, through study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: comparing femoral anteversion after THR using CT scan

secondary_outcome.description: The HHS is a physician-completed instrument that consists of subscales for pain severity (1 item, 0-44 points), function (7 items, 0-47 points), absence of deformity (1 item, 0-4 points), and range of motion (2 items, 0-5 points). Where a score < 70 indicating a poor result and those of 90-100 indicating an excellent result

arm_group.description: Patients after total hip arthroplasty with short femoral stem

intervention.intervention_name: Short anatomical femoral stem in THR
intervention.description: Patients with osteoarthritis after total hip arthroplasty

study_pop.textblock: patients aged 18 - 90 who had THR as an elective surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18-90
- patients who had THR as an elective surgery
- patients who had THR with short femoral anatomical stem
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe osteoporosis with Dorr C classification
- s/p bilateral hip arthroplasty
- non-complaint patients
- revision surgery
